com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.map

Class MapDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.map.MapDisplay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Tickable, MapDisplayEvents
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MapTestDisplay

    public class MapDisplay
extends java.lang.Object
implements MapDisplayEvents
    A MapDisplay updates and displays map contents to a group of players set as owners. Owners can also be set to provide input to the map using steering controls. All owners will receiver map updates when they can see the map, and only when contents change. Non-owners will never see these updates. The display is purely virtual, meaning that the map contents are never saved on the server.

    Owner input can be intercepted, allowing the owner of the map to control it directly using steering controls. The easiest way to enable this, is to set #setReceiveInputWhenHolding(opt) to true. Alternatively it can be set for individual owners using #setReceiveInput(owner, opt). Please note that the player can not move around while input is intercepted.

    To use this class, it should be further implemented to add custom functionality:
  • onAttached() is called after the map display is initialized
  • onDetached() is called right before the map display is de-initialized
  • onTick() is called every tick, do logic updates and drawing here
  • #onKeyPressed(Event) is called whenever an owner presses a key (down)
  • #onKeyReleased(Event) is called whenever an owner releases a key (up)
  • #onKey(event) is called every tick while the owner is holding down a key
  • #onLeftClick(event) is called when a player left-clicks on the map
  • #onRightClick(event) is called when a player right-clicks on the map

      • addOwner

        public void addOwner(org.bukkit.entity.Player owner)
        Adds an owner to this Map Display that will receive map updates and can perform key input. If this is the first owner being added, and #initialize(plugin, mapItem) has been called, the display will start updating automatically. If there is an existing Map Display for this map, that also is owned by this player, this player is removed as owner and re-added once this Map Display stops.
        Parameters:
        owner - to add

      • removeOwner

        public void removeOwner(org.bukkit.entity.Player owner)
        Removes an owner from this Map Display that will no longer receive map updates.
        Parameters:
        owner - to remove

        Returns:

      • isGlobal

        public boolean isGlobal()
        Gets whether this Map Display is global. New players that view this map will automatically see the contents of this Map Display if global. By default this is set to true.
        Returns:
        True if this Map Display is visible to all players

      • setGlobal

        public void setGlobal(boolean global)
        Sets whether this Map Display is global. New players that view this this map will automatically see the contents of this Map Display if global. By default this is set to true.

        If it is important that players can not see the contents maps that other players see, this should be set to false.
        Parameters:
        global - option to set to

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate()
        Invalidates the entire view area of this MapDisplay, causing the display contents to be re-sent to all viewers.

      • update

        public final void update()
        Performs all the updates required to display this Map Display to its viewers. This is called automatically after having called start() on one of the implementations. It should only be called when manually managing the map is required.

        Parameters:
        item - to set to

      • setUpdateWithoutViewers

        public void setUpdateWithoutViewers(boolean updateWhenNotViewing)
        Sets whether this Virtual Map's onTick() method is called when no players are currently viewing this map. By default this is set to true.
        Parameters:
        updateWithoutViewers - option

      • setReceiveInputWhenHolding

        public void setReceiveInputWhenHolding(boolean inputWhenHolding)
        Sets whether player input is received when players are holding the map in their main hand. Input is intercepted, which means they can no longer move around while holding the map. They need to switch to a different item slot to be able to walk again.

        By default this is set to false
        Parameters:
        inputWhenHolding - to set to

      • isReceivingInput

        public boolean isReceivingInput(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Gets whether player input is received and used for controlling this map. If received, the player can not move around and map input is available. By default this is set to False.
        Parameters:
        player - viewer to get the option for
        Returns:
        True if input is intercepted, False if not.

      • setReceiveInput

        public void setReceiveInput(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                            boolean interceptInput)
        Sets whether player input is received and used for controlling this map. If received, the player can not move around and map input is available. By default this is set to False.
        Parameters:
        player - viewer to set the option for
        interceptInput - option

      • getViewedDisplay

        public static MapDisplay getViewedDisplay(org.bukkit.entity.Player viewer,
                                          org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
        Gets the Map Display bound to a map item, viewed by the player. If the item is not a map item, or the map item has no displays bound to it for the player, null is returned.
        Parameters:

        item - with map information
        Returns:

        Parameters:
        mapItem -

      • getHeldDisplay

        public static MapDisplay getHeldDisplay(org.bukkit.entity.Player viewer)

        Returns:
        held map display, null if not holding any map with a display

      • getHeldDisplay

        public static <T extends MapDisplay> T getHeldDisplay(org.bukkit.entity.Player viewer,
                                                      java.lang.Class<T> displayClass)
        Gets the map display a player is viewing in a map held in his hand. When viewing a map display in both hands, the main hand display is returned. When the player is not viewing any display, null is returned instead. This method allows specifying a restriction for what map displays to return. When viewing two maps in both hands, and the off hand is the display class type, this method allows returning that display.
        Parameters:
        viewer -
        displayClass -
        Returns:
        held map display, null if not holding any map with a display
